ygData.subject: Re: Master Fletcher Here
ygData.msgSnippet: Just raise prices to cover the cost. Also a quote from one of the SK news groups ... Wondering how much damage you can inflict with an arrow, right about now,
ygData.messageBody:
Just raise prices to cover the cost.

Also a quote from one of the SK news groups

>Perhaps that will convince you that no one
>can tank a spectre. To put it simply, one must Ensnare or Darkness the
>creature and run around until it is as dead as possible, then going oom
>before you engage. No matter what armor you got and how many HP you have,
>the spectre is still going to hit for 60, 70, 50, 80 in one round. Now, how
>many of those rounds can 1000HP take?

Wondering how much damage you can inflict with an arrow, right about now,
although it would probably need to be a magic arrow(or would a magic bow be
good enough?).

David

----- Original Message -----
From: Charles Adams <sirkal@...>
To: <EQ_Fletchers@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, June 15, 1999 11:24 AM
Subject: [EQ_Fletchers] Master Fletcher Here


From: Charles Adams <sirkal@...>

I am a Master Fletcher with a skill of 149. Oak bows are not trivial to me.

As of the new patch, I spent 8 plat per point of skill gained. We all need
to /feedback that each of these "bundles" should be giving us 5x the skill
checks of the before the patch. Or there aren't going to be a lot of
Fletchers left. What this patch did was give people who already have a huge
lead an unfair advantage.

The only reason I got into Fletching was because it was so cheap. I figured
eventually I would sell a couple of nice Oaks and that would completely pay
for the entire skill. (And upto the patch it had).

Now I not only have to deal with the fact that people don't seem to
understand the bow. (And there is no /auction in the world that can do that
in a couple of lines) Let along understand the almost exponential increase
in cost for a small gain. But now the cost of increasing my skill has
become absurd.

Just wanted to get that rant out in the open. I implore everyone to
/feedback that the skill checks for Fletching need to be improved.

By the way Vytautas thanks for mentioning my site in your last post!

Charles
